bugs.title: CVE-2013-6401 jansson: hash table collisions CPU usage DoS

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2013-6401 jansson: hash table collisions CPU usage DoS

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that the hashing implementation in Jansson, a library for encoding, decoding and manipulating JSON data, was susceptible to predictable hash collisions. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause an application using Jansson to use an excessive amount of CPU time by sending a crafted JSON document containing a large number of parameters whose names map to the same hash value.

Acknowledgements:

This issue was discovered by Florian Weimer of the Red Hat Product Security Team.

Created attachment 859025
CVE-2013-6401 patch
Public now: https://github.com/akheron/jansson/commit/8f80c2d83808150724d31793e6ade92749b1faa4

(In reply to Murray McAllister from comment #7)
> Public now:
> https://github.com/akheron/jansson/commit/
> 8f80c2d83808150724d31793e6ade92749b1faa4

This one is also needed: https://github.com/akheron/jansson/commit/42016a35c8907e477be73b0b5d06cc09af231ee4

Created jansson tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1063819]

Created jansson tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1063817]

The first patch is very very long. According to github, 

19 changed files with 873 additions and 122 deletions

is this the minimal patch for fixing this CVE? Or does it include extra fixes??

thanks

(In reply to Jordi Massaguer Pla from comment #12)
> The first patch is very very long. According to github, 
> 
> 19 changed files with 873 additions and 122 deletions
> 
> is this the minimal patch for fixing this CVE? Or does it include extra
> fixes??

No, it fixes just this bug.  It replaces the hashing function and adds random seeding.
jansson-2.6-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
Closing as all dependent OS releases have fixes out

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora EPEL.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When creating a Bodhi update request, please use the bodhi submission link
noted in the next comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this
tracking bug as well as the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
Bodhi notes field when available.

epel-6 tracking bug for jansson: see blocks bug list for full details of the security issue(s).

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Please use the following update submission link to create the Bodhi
request for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well
as this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get
updated when new packages are pushed to stable.

Please also ensure that the "Close bugs when update is stable" option
remains checked.

Bodhi update submission link:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/new/?type_=security&bugs=1035538,1063819

jansson-2.6-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/jansson-2.6-1.el6

I've updated the package in EPEL to 2.6 (as backporting the patch to 2.5 was beyond my skillset, and this patch was the main reason for the 2.6 release), and have filed a Bohdi update.  If you're so inclined, please test the package (once it gets into the testing repo) and give it karma.

Package jansson-2.6-1.el6:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing jansson-2.6-1.el6'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2014-0565/jansson-2.6-1.el6
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
jansson-2.6-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

notes: Update to upstream 2.6 version to handle security issue CVE-2013-6401, which can cause a denial of service attack by using a large amount of CPU cycles
